elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Assign the following cases to one of the four categories.

elements.name: Frage 1
elements.title: 18-year-old Alessandra is doing an apprenticeship as a gardener and wants to book a trip to Mallorca.

elements.name: Begründung1
elements.title: Reason
elements.correctAnswer: Alessandra is of legal age and capable of judgment in the situation described.

elements.name: Frage 2
elements.title: 19-year-old Jonas lives in an assisted shared flat because he is manic-depressive. In his manic phase, he wants to buy all sorts of things that would go way beyond his budget. Now he wants to buy a scooter for CHF 3000.

elements.name: Begründung2
elements.title: Reason
elements.correctAnswer: Although Jonas is of legal age, his capacity to make decisions is limited due to his illness.

elements.name: Frage 3
elements.title: 12-year-old Sandro would like to buy a skateboard for CHF 50 with the pocket money he has saved.

elements.name: Begründung3
elements.title: Reason
elements.correctAnswer: In this specific situation, Sandro is capable of judgment but not yet of legal age.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: 30-year-old Svenja is severely mentally disabled and therefore lives in a residential home where she receives round-the-clock care. She would like to buy her own car.

elements.name: Begründung4
elements.title: Reason
elements.correctAnswer: Although Svenja is of legal age, she is unable to make decisions due to her severe disability.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: 17-year-old Antonella is passionate about rugby and would like to use her pocket money to buy new equipment for CHF 200.

elements.name: Begründung5
elements.title: Reason
elements.correctAnswer: Although Antonella is capable of judgment with regard to her purchase, she is not yet of legal age.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: 5-year-old Robin wants to buy a high-quality drone for CHF 2000 because he saw a teenager filming his friends in the playground.

elements.name: Begründung6
elements.title: Reason
elements.correctAnswer: Robin is neither of legal age nor capable of judgment with regard to his desired purchase (small experience - big consequences).
